text: Improvement pill here what if I told you
that there was an activity that takes
only an hour or two per week to do that
can drastically increase your confidence
creativity social skills lower your
social anxiety and overall make you into
a more fun and attractive person well a
study conducted in 2017 it took 268
students and had them participate in a
10-week school-based improv theater
program they had the students take
service before and after the program was
completed and found that students who
showed up to the program saw a
significant Improvement in their social
anxiety creativity and it even lowered
their depression yes what I'm talking
about today is improv now for those of
you that don't know what this is it's
basically an acting game where you role
play as different characters in a wide
variety of scenarios the players take
turns acting and adding more information
into the scene of further developing the
story and there are three reasons why
this is so powerful reason number one
the yes and Rule one of the most
important rules in improv is What's
called the yes and Rule basically you
must agree with whatever over new
information other players introduce into
the scene and add on to it if someone
says they're an evil villain who just
kidnapped your mom you have to act as if
that actually happened this teaches you
to become a more open-minded person
which is one of the most attractive
traits out there someone who is open to
everything is someone that can connect
with almost everyone when people see
that you are accepting of all beliefs
and open to new experiences there will
be less hesitant to hold back they will
feel more comfortable around you
learning how to use yes and also teaches
you how to have more fun spontaneous
moments in real life I was once at a bar
that had seats that could spin a woman
sitting next to me spun my seat by
accident while looking in her bag and
apologized now I could have just said
it's okay but instead I looked at her
and I said spin me more two minutes
later we were spinning each other like
kids on a playground trying to see who
could walk in a straight line it was
loads of fun and it was all because I
added onto The Accidental scenario that
she placed Us in That's The Power of yes
and reason number two embrace the fool
when you do improv you will find
yourself in ridiculous scenarios you
might have to play someone who just got
their towel stolen in the shower where
you're forced to run back to your room
acting like you're naked when you have
to act out embarrassing moments like
this you are purposely acting like a
fool and this is a good thing because
we're all scared of saying something or
acting a certain way that would cause
people to look down on us in real life
however much social anxiety you have
right now is determined by how scared
you are of looking like a fool in real
life by purposely putting on the Fool's
hat you'll learn how to become more
comfortable in front of others if you
can pretend to be a dinosaur in front of
10 people sparking up a conversation
with a stranger in the grocery who feel
easy in comparison and as an added bonus
you will gain the ability to be the life
of the party take a look at this famous
clip everyone is scared of looking
stupid so no one's dancing then this one
guy who doesn't mind looking silly gets
up and starts dancing like crazy soon
others join him and it eventually grows
into a huge party when you learn to
embrace the fool it becomes magnetic
others want to be around you because
letting go is fun if you're going to try
to do this you have to be enjoying
yourself in the moment and you have to
do so confidently without looking at
others to see if they're okay with it
you got to be in the zone having a blast
and then others will come and finally
reason number three endless
conversations one of the biggest issues
people have when socializing is not
knowing what to say next they might have
a couple of ideas in their mind but by
the time they decide how to respond the
conversation has already moved forward
onto something else personally I almost
never run out of things to say if I like
someone's shirt I'll blurt it out if I
don't agree with something someone says
I'll make a comment I'm just speaking my
mind only occasionally second doubting
myself when I have a highly
controversial thought when you do improv
you have to quickly act because everyone
else is waiting on you if someone tells
you that they just injected you with
Dinosaur serum you have to quickly think
of what happens next and react over time
you learn to speak your mind or in this
case act out whatever pops up in your
mind this strange due to instinctively
further conversations in real life
instead of overthinking things so if you
want to improve your social skills I
suggest you look up the nearest improv
class most large cities have a couple of
Facebook groups that focus on them just
search for it online and if you want to
improve your social skills some more you
should check out the other episodes in
the befriend course by clicking on the
link in the description box below
besides that stay tuned
